title: Sans Serif Typefaces with Medieval Designs?
content:
¶ Some Twenties and Thirties Sans Serif feature a couple of letters derived from the early or late Middle Age.  
· · · **Examples** : [Bayer's Universal](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417143317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/bayer-universal/), [Goudy Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417143317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-goudy-sans/), Lydian, Peignot.

¶ Can you list some and explain the linkage (uncial, caroline, insular, beneventan, fraktur) of the letters?  
· · · **Thanks**.
author: Fournier
